duties_responsibilities.duty: Greet and direct visitors and examinees in a professional manner.
Answer and screen incoming telephone calls, obtain caller details, and route calls appropriately.
Review charts, provide required paperwork to examinees, and direct to examination rooms.
Chaperone examinations when necessary and maintain examination schedule.
Perform clerical duties such as typing, filing, emailing, and proofreading.
Oversee lobby cleanliness and report any issues to management.
Promote effective utilization of clinical resources and supplies.
Participate in educational/training activities and perform other assigned duties.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of 6 months on-the-job experience in a medical office or related field preferred.
Valid state Driver’s License and ability to perform day travel as required.
Complete knowledge of general computer, fax, copier, scanner, and telephone operations.
Knowledge of multiple software programs, including Microsoft Word, Excel, and the Internet.
Bilingual in Spanish and/or Chinese is a plus.
